Uses of Class
pulse.problem.schemes.DifferenceScheme

  • Packages that use DifferenceScheme 
    Package Description
    pulse.problem.schemes
    This package deals with anything associated with finite differences in PULsE, including the definition of Grids, which define the partitioning rules for space and time variables, the discretised Pulse on any of those grids, and finite-difference schemes, which subclass DifferenceScheme.
    pulse.problem.statements
    Introduces various problem statements for the heat conduction problem in the laser flash experiment.
    pulse.tasks
    Introduces the SearchTask, which is the main actor in PULsE, and the TaskManager, a high-level class which among other functions manages loading and executing SearchTasks.

    • Uses of DifferenceScheme in pulse.problem.schemes

      Subclasses of DifferenceScheme in pulse.problem.schemes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      class  ADIScheme  
      class  ExplicitScheme
      This class implements the simple explicit finite-difference scheme (also called the forward-time centered space scheme) for solving the one-dimensional heat conduction problem.
      class  ImplicitScheme
      This class implements the fully implicit finite-difference scheme for solving the one-dimensional heat conduction problem.
      class  MixedScheme
      This class implements a symmetric (weight = 0.5) second-order in time Crank-Nicolson semi-implicit finite-difference scheme for solving the one-dimensional heat conduction problem.

      Modifier and Type Method Description

      Creates a DifferenceScheme, which is an exact copy of this object.
      DifferenceScheme ExplicitScheme.copy()

      Copies the Grid and timeLimit from df.
